Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Thus , a homozygous germ - line MLH1 mutation and consequent mismatch repair deficiency results in a mutator phenotype characterized by leukemia and / or lymphoma associated with neurofibromatosis type 1 . .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| homozygous germ-line MLH1 mutation |
| mismatch repair deficiency |
| mutator phenotype |
| leukemia |
| lymphoma |
| neurofibromatosis type 1 |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| homozygous germ-line MLH1 mutation |
| mismatch repair deficiency |
| mutator phenotype |
| leukemia |
| lymphoma |
| neurofibromatosis type 1 |

Note: In this context, "mutator phenotype" is a term used to describe a condition or state where the rate of genetic mutations is increased, which can lead to various diseases. Therefore, it is considered a disease or a condition in this context.
